intro: Potentilla wallichiana var. anemonifolia, commonly known as the Himalayan meadow cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, typically arranged in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with five leaflets, giving it a resemblance to anemone species, hence its common name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
